data.title: Lightning Strikes Twice
data.meta_description: Lightning Strikes Twice is the sixth episode of the first season of Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue! data.text:
This needs a stretch. (Feel free to remove when satisfied of completion.)

Needed: Synopsis.

Lightning Strikes Twice is the sixth episode of the first season of Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!

Premise[]

After a bad experience from the past with lightning, Dr. Phibes creates a machine from his space station that causes thunderstorms across the world. Uncle Albert informs Shaggy and Scooby to face this rather than hide in the basement. Now Scooby must face his fear of lightning, as he and Shaggy work on a way to stop Phibes.

Synopsis[]

Insert details here.

Notes/trivia[]

While Scooby-Doo is generally not as cowardly in this series as he was in past incarnations, he is still afraid of lightning.

Agents 2, 3, and 7 are a part of a UFO club. Agent 2 is called "Blothar" and Agent 7 is called "Bernie" (which sounds more like it might be his real name).

They played less villainous roles in this episode (especially Agent 2), but only because they were duped into helping the heroes due to their high gullibleness.

Miscellaneous[]

Super Scooby Snack: Super speed.

Mystery Machine transformation: Space shuttle.

Animation mistakes and/or technical glitches[]

None known.

Inconsistencies/continuity errors and/or goofs/oddities[]

Phibes seemingly has an alien on his team to begin with, so his fear and the need for the UFO club to seek out the "aliens" (as if it's a momentous occasion) are redundant.

In other languages[]

Language Name Meaning French La foudre frappe toujours deux fois Lightning Always Strikes Twice Greek Η Αστραπή Χτυπάει Δυο Φορές Τhe Lightning Strikes Twice Spanish (Latin America) Efectos Insospechados Unsuspected Effects

Home media[]

Shaggy & Scooby-Doo Get a Clue!: Volume 2 DVD released by Warner Home Video on July 8, 2008.

Scooby-Doo, Where Are You!: Volume 4 - Spooked Bayou DVD released by Warner Home Video on October 19, 2010.
